article_title: Spieth Leads in Masters but Veteran Langer Lingers Nearby
article_text:
AUGUSTA, Ga.—The last time Bernhard Langer won the Masters, Jordan Spieth hadn’t been born. It was 1993, just a few months before the birth of Spieth, when Langer won the second of his two green jackets. By now, his presence on golf’s grandest stage was supposed to be largely ceremonial.

That is how modern golf works. Players in their 20s are dominating, players in their 30s are having trouble keeping up and players with gray hair and wrinkly foreheads are hopeless. And yet, the final round of the Masters will begin...

twitter.description: The final round of the Masters will begin Sunday with Bernhard Langer, at age 58, among the players who are best positioned to stop Jordan Spieth, 22, from repeating as champion.
twitter.creator: @BrianCostaWSJ

image.alt: Spieth Leads in Masters but Veteran Langer Lingers Nearby
